title: [Self-directed] Universal Design for Inclusive Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Mathematical Concepts and Experience with Digital Learning Tools
context.additional_context: A mathematics application development course for aspiring professionals in medical/legal/technical fields, with inclusive environment design as a core requirement to accommodate learners with diverse social identities.

learning_goals: Learners can design mathematics education modules that consider diverse social backgrounds—such as gender identity and sexual orientation—by applying UID principles.
Learners can create microlearning content that minimizes accessibility barriers in mobile environments.
Learners can understand the concept of intersectionality and apply it to interdisciplinary mathematics problems.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
